intro: Aetheorhyncha, commonly known as the golden cup plant, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces yellow-orange flower heads that are composed of many small, tubular florets. Aetheorhyncha typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture.
